thread.title: Two plays on tap on South Plains stages
thread.title_full: Two plays on tap on South Plains stages

author: Staff
title: Two plays on tap on South Plains stages
text:
Two plays on tap on South Plains stages Theater Box Photos 
“The Uninvited” — 7:30 p.m. Thursday, Helen DeVitt Jones Theatre at South Plains College, E.M. Barnes Drive and Magnolia Street in Levelland. Supernatural mystery-romance based on the Dorothy Macarle novel “Uneasy Freehold.” Directed by Daniel K. Nazworth. Tickets $5 for the general public and $3 for students; sold at the door. (806) 716-2266. 
Future performances Oct. 16-18. 
“You Can’t Take It With You” — 8 p.m. Friday-Saturday, and 2 p.m. Sunday, Texas Tech Maedgen Theatre, 2812 18th St. between Boston and Flint avenues. Zany comedy by Moss Hart and George S. Kaufman. Directed by Jonathan Marks; cast includes alums/former theater students Jaston Williams, Richard Privitt, Kim Ansolabehere and Sylvia Ashby. Reserved seats $18 ($5 for students with valid IDs; free student rush tickets available on a limited basis to Tech students). 742-3603. 
Final performances.
